body:
Comment 6: 
I can't reproduce your problem. I am running http test (hg id: 8ea3939bd68a) in a loop
and it runs with no problems. Using Windows 2000 and Windows Server 2003 here. Both have
single cpu. I am wandering if number of cpus makes any difference. Or, perhaps, my
computers are slow.

If you can reproduce the problem in your environment, perhaps, you could run test with
-test.timeout=30 parameter. This way test will blow in 30 seconds if it hangs, and we
all will have stack trace to look at. Not sure if it is much help, but ...

Thank you.

Alex
